channel.title: event on Quanteda Initiative
channel.description: Recent content in event on Quanteda Initiative

item.title: Call for papers: COMPTEXT conference in Innsbruck on 15-16 May 2020
item.description: COMPTEXT is an international and interdisciplinary symposium on the application of natural language processing techniques to social science research.

item.title: Workshop at POLTEXT 2019 in Tokyo
item.description: As part of the pre-conference events at POLTEXT 2019 at Waseda University in Toyko, Stefan Müller conducted a workshop on Quantitative Text Analysis for Absolute Beginners.

item.title: Workshop at the Swiss National Science Foundation
item.description: Stefan Müller led a two-day workshop on quantitative text analysis using R and quanteda at the Swiss National Science Foundation (SNSF) in Berne on 30-31 July 2019.

item.title: Workshop at the University of Münster
item.description: Ken Benoit led a two-day workshop on quantitative text analysis using R and quanteda at the University of Münster on 27-28 June 2019.

item.title: Text analysis workshop at the University of Bergen
item.description: Stefan Müller led a two-day workshop on quantitative text analysis using R and quanteda at the University of Bergen on 25–26 April 2019.

item.title: Seminar presentation by Kenneth Benoit at the University of Auckland
item.description: On Thursday, 24 January 2019 at 3pm, Kenneth Benoit will give a talk at the Public Policy Institute of the University of Auckland about ‘The Ten Most Important Things I’ve Learned about Quantitative Text Analysis’.

item.title: Call for papers: POLTEXT symposium in Tokyo on 14-15 September 2019
item.description: POLTEXT is an international and interdisciplinary symposium on the application of natural language processing techniques in social science research.

item.title: Text analysis workshop before the Annual Meeting of the Australian Society for Quantitative Political Science
item.description: Kenneth Benoit led an introductory workshop on quantitative text analysis using R and quanteda.

item.title: Text analysis workshop at BIGSSS & SOCIUM in Bremen
item.description: Kenneth Benoit and Stefan Müller will hold a two-day workshop on text-as-data approaches and the quanteda package on 22-23 November 2018 in Bremen.

item.title: Quanteda presentation at Tokyo R meeting
item.description: At a meeting of Tokyo R on 15 June 2018 at Yahoo Japan’s headquarters, Kohei Watanabe presented an overview of quantitative text analysis and how to implement it using the latest version of quanteda.

item.title: Text analysis workshop at WZB Berlin
item.description: Kohei Watanabe and Stefan Müller held a workshop on quanteda on 31 January 2018, the day before the Manifesto Corpus Conference 2018 held from 1-2 February 2018 at the WZB Berlin Social Science Center.

item.title: Quanteda v1.0 launch at LondonR event
item.description: At a meeting of London R meeting on 16 January 2018, we announced the release of quanteda v1.

item.title: Text analysis workshop at ESSSC
item.description: We will convene a half-day workshop at European Symposium Series on Societal Challenges in Computational Social Science on quantitative text analysis using quanteda.
